description: NOTICE OF REMOVAL from 236th District Court, Tarrant County, case number 236-313994-19 filed by Erin Nealy Cox. (Filer fee note- Filed by the USA) In each Notice of Electronic Filing, the judge assignment is indicated, and a link to the Judges Copy Requirements is provided. The court reminds the filer that any required copy of this and future documents must be delivered to the judge, in the manner prescribed, within three business days of filing. Unless exempted, attorneys who are not admitted to practice in the Northern District of Texas must seek admission promptly. Forms and Instructions found at www.txnd.uscourts.gov, or by clicking here: Attorney Information - Bar Membership. If admission requirements are not satisfied within 21 days, the clerk will notify the presiding judge. (Attachments: # 1 Cover Sheet, # 2 Cover Sheet Supplement, # 3 Index of State Court Records, # 4 State Court Docket Sheet, # 5 Original Petition, # 6 Demand re: Costs/Fees, # 7 Service Request, # 8 Demand re: Costs/Fees, # 9 Tarrant County DA and Sheriff's Answer, # 10 Tarrant County DA and Sheriff's Motion to Dismiss and to Declare Plaintiff a Vexatious Litigant, # 11 Notice of Hearing, # 12 Officer's Return - Wilson, # 13 Officer's Return - Brown, # 14 Officer's Return - Martin, # 15 Officer's Return - TCSO, # 16 Officer's Return - McBryde, # 17 Officer's Return - Graham, # 18 Officer's Return - Collingwood, # 19 Officer's Return - Hurtado, # 20 Officer's Return - Echols-Kirksey, # 21 Officer's Return - Britton, # 22 Officer's Return - White, # 23 Euless Defendants' Motion to Dismiss, # 24 Euless Defendants' Answer, # 25 Proposed Order for Euless Defendants' Motion to Dismiss) (Stoltz-DOJ, Brian) (Entered: 02/23/2020)

description: Memorandum Opinion and Order.  For the reasons set forth herein, the Court finds that Plaintiffs have failed to satisfy their burden of demonstrating, by clear and convincing evidence, that the Guardian Entities were intended to be the obligee s on the Royal and Safeco Lease Bonds.  The Court determines, rather, that CMC was the intended original obligee, and that the Guardian Entities succeeded to the rights of CMC by virtue of various assignment transactions.  Accordingly, Plaintiffs are not entitled to reformation of the Lease Bonds.  Judge Kathleen M. O'Malley on 5/28/2010. (H,CM)

description: OPINION & ORDER   re: (37 in 7:14-cv-03067-KMK)  CROSS  MOTION  for Summary Judgment . filed by   W.A.,   M.S., (32 in 7:14-cv-03067-KMK)    MOTION  for Summary Judgment and to Amend Answer, filed by   Hendrick Hudson Central School Dis trict. The Court grants Defendant's Motion in part and denies  it in part, and grants Plaintiffs' Motion in part and denies it in part. Plaintiffs'  Motion is granted with respect to the tuition reimbursement sought for the 2012-2013 s chool year.  Defendant's Motion is granted in all other respects. The Clerk of the Court is respectfully  requested to terminate the pending Motions. (See Dkt. Nos. 32, 37.) Defendant is to file its Amended  Answer within two weeks of the date o f this Opinion. The Court will hold a conference on December  16, 2016, at 3:00PM. SO ORDERED., (Status Conference set for 12/16/2016 at 03:00 PM before Judge Kenneth M. Karas.)  (Signed by Judge Kenneth M. Karas on 11/23/16)  Filed In Associated Cases: 7:14-cv-03067-KMK, 7:14-cv-04285-KMK(yv)
